title: Allow for testing with junit ConsoleLauncher
body:

### Implementation ideas

It looks like Quarkus assumes that its QuarkusTestExtension class will be loaded by something that falls below the SystemClassLoader, which is not the case when using JUnit Console Launcher (as that sets the classloader to a URIClassLoader).

The specific dependency seems to go like this:
https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/11f39400da701bc49da3635436307a8d6f6ea7a0/test-framework/junit5/src/main/java/io/quarkus/test/junit/AbstractJvmQuarkusTestExtension.java#L154-L164

The Quarkus application is started with the default classloader which is retrieved with `ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader` (Inside of `QuarkusBootstrap.Builder`. you'll have to trust me). This classloader is then used to create the internal/custom Quarkus ClassLoaders. One of those internal ClassLoaders (the Augmentation ClassLoader specifically) is used to load some more classes

https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/657ae2965955ba1bd015d2049e4830dc223c1b36/independent-projects/bootstrap/core/src/main/java/io/quarkus/bootstrap/app/CuratedApplication.java#L130-L135

This is where the exception is thrown. The Quarkus ClassLoader that loads `AugmentActionImpl` doesn't have our URLClassLoader in the parent chain (since it was created from the system ClassLoader). So when we get the constructor on line 135 we are mixing the two distinct class spaces. That's no good.

Empirically i have found that explicitly setting the runnerBuilder BaseClassLoader in `AbstractJvmQuarkusTestExtension.java:157` to `this.getClass().getClassLoader()` solves this issue, since Quarkus will then be loaded as a child of the URLClassLoader.
